content: Having an edge like 0 only in the validators might not be ideal.

This statement is terrible!

"The goal is to check if 2 or more strings are anagrams of each other, which means they contain the same letters but not necessarily in the same order."

This sounds VERY much like the problem is asking us to see if there are "2 or more" anagrams among the lists. What you are REALLY asking is "are ALL of the strings provided anagrams of each other".

Having most of your test cases only consist of 2 cases makes this a lot harder to notice in a clash, then you just get stuck on the impossible Large cases and can't understand why you are getting the wrong answers.

You should edit the statement to clarify that the problem is whether they are ALL anagrams of one another not just "2 or more" of them are anagrams... I lost on a clash because I didn't understand what you were asking.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I accept

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's ok

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle

Goal section
* Not enough explanation, especially what the requirement is when there are more than 2 strings.

* Also missing explanation on when {{UNKNOWN}} should be output.

Input section
* Please change [[S]] to [[string]] to be consistent with the stub generator.

Output section
* Please change "output" to "Line 1".

* Please format "true", "false" and "UNKNOWN" as {{constants}} instead of [[variables]].

Constraints section
* Please change [[Strings]] to [[string]] to be consistent with the stub generator.

* Please move "Ignore case and spaces" to Goal section because that is not a constraint; that is part of the details of the requirement.

Cases
* Please change the cases so that there are no duplicates.

Thanks.

I suggest you put a case where there are 3 words also.  

It’s a big leap to go from comparing two words to comparing 10 words (especially 10 words that are long and hard/impossible to manually compare)
Thank you for your comment. You are totally right, I just added this test case :)

Thank you for your detailed feedback. 
This is my first contribution and I'm grateful for the opportunity to improve. 

I have carefully reviewed your remarks and I think I applied the necessary corrections. 
If you have any further suggestions or comments on how I can make my contribution even better, please don't hesitate to let me know. 
Also, if you're satisfied with the changes, I would greatly appreciate an upvote. 

Thank you again for your time and feedback, it's greatly appreciated!
Thank you very much for taking the time to review and approve my contribution. I am glad to hear that you found it nice.
Thank you for giving the final approval :)
I added "ALL" to the statement just now.

Saying "check that 2 or more are anagrams OF EACH OTHER" seems clear to me; for me, 2 or more = all. Otherwise, I would have specified checking them pairwise, and N would be equal to the number of groups of strings to compare, not the number of strings.

We all lose battles for various reasons, but to say that it's "terrible" might be a bit of an overreaction, and perhaps we should take a step back and reassess for a moment.

From my perspective, I agree that there's always room for improvement, so I accept the feedback and apologize if the instructions were unclear to you.

Thank you for following up.

Test 1 and Validator 1 are still the same. Please change them so that they are different.

My bad ! I had a moment of confusion on this test/validator due to the example case. I changed that now ! That was a silly mistake on my part, thank you for pointing it out and thank you again for your feedback.

I like your choices: Magic Node !!
Coco flashed !!!

I'm glad that you appreciate it ^^. 
If you feel that my contribution was valuable, I would appreciate an upvote. Your support would mean a lot to me and would motivate me to continue contributing to the community. 
Once again, thank you for taking the time to provide feedback and suggestions. Happy coding!
